title: Olivier Salad (Russian Potato Salad)
description: A classic Slavic potato salad with vegetables, eggs, and mayonnaise.
instructions: Boil potatoes and carrots until tender, let cool, then peel.
Dice potatoes, carrots, eggs, pickles, onion, and meat into small cubes.
Add peas and mix all ingredients in a large bowl.
Stir in mayonnaise until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper. Chill before serving.
(Optional) Garnish with fresh dill or parsley for a festive touch.

title: Myaso Po-Albanskii (Albanian-Style Meat)
description: A savory Slavic dish of fried meat patties mixed with onions and spices.
instructions: Finely chop or grate the onions.
Cube the meat into small pieces.
In a mixing bowl, combine meat, onions, flour, egg, and mayonnaise. Mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Spoon portions of the mixture into the pan, shaping into patties.
Fry until golden brown on both sides and cooked through.
Serve hot with mashed potatoes or buckwheat porridge.

title: Shuba Salad (Herring Under a Blanket)
description: A layered Slavic salad featuring herring, vegetables, and mayonnaise.
ingredients: 2 small or 1 large jar of pickled herring
instructions: Boil potatoes, carrots, and beets separately until tender. Let cool, then peel.
Dice the herring fillets and place as the bottom layer in a dish.
Grate potatoes, add as the next layer, and spread a thin layer of mayonnaise.
Add grated carrots, another thin layer of mayonnaise.
Add grated beets as the top layer, finishing with mayonnaise.
Grate boiled eggs on top for garnish.
Chill for several hours before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve cold, sliced into neat squares.
